keyword: how many calories are in a grilled cheese
title: How Many Calories Are in a Grilled Cheese?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a grilled cheese sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Grilled Cheese?
assumptions: Standard grilled cheese: 2 slices white bread, 2 slices cheddar cheese (1 oz each), 1 tbsp butter for grilling.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, cheese brand, butter amount, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical grilled cheese sandwich contains about 400 calories and 18g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white
Add 2 slices tomato and skip butter
Use low-fat cheese (1 oz each slice)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 400 calories for a standard version with white bread and cheddar.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a grilled cheese?
faqs.a: About 18g protein, mostly from the cheese.

faqs.q: Does grilled cheese have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 24g total fat, with 12g saturated from cheese and butter.

faqs.q: How to make a lower-calorie grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Opt for whole grain bread, low-fat cheese, and cook with minimal oil or in a nonstick pan.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in a grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Roughly 850mg, mainly from cheese and bread; varies by ingredients.
